intro: Canthium umbelligerum, commonly known as the African hogweed, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa, characterized by its tall, erect stems and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in swampy areas or along riverbanks.
